text: I know this is not exactly what you are trying to do but we solved similar situation here: <https://www.happysignals.com/learning-center>
but unfortunately someone has disabled lazyloading and forgot to use `resize_image_url`
Propably not directly as a database that wp use as its core but yes, you can get data from hubdb and use it in wordpress.
I mean you can always build a for loop and sort the items as you loop over them
yeah thats what I ended up doing lol hubl sucks

If I have multiple HubDB rows returned, how can I check to see if the datetime values all occur on the same date?

Edit: maybe not the most elegant way, but this worked...
`{% set comparison = [] %}`
  `{% for variation in variations %}`
    `{% do comparison.append(variation.datetime_utc|datetimeformat('%B %e', 'America/New_York')) %}`
  `{% endfor %}`
  `{% if comparison|unique|length == 1 %}`
